person.persName: Samuel S. Scott (Provisional Government of Kentucky)

body.p: A Kentucky physician, surgeon, and politician. Worked as a clerk in John C. Lindsay’s store at Ghent, Kentucky. Educated in the medical department at Transylvania University and graduated in 1842. Practiced medicine in Ghent. Further education at the Medical College of Ohio in 1853. Married to Evelyn F. O’Hara Scott. Father of Charles O’Hara Scott, Mary L. Scott, Robert A. Scott, and John Scott. Member of the Jeffersonian Democratic Party and Whig Party. Owned two enslaved persons in 1860. Served as a senior surgeon with the filibusterers under General Lopez, enlisting 250 Carroll County men as the Kentucky Regiment in the failed excursion to Cardenas, Cuba in 1850. Served as a private in Colonel Roger Hanson’s Confederate regiment in the Civil War. Served as a surgeon in a Bowling Green hospital under Dr. David Yandell and in Major Phifer’s Arkansas Cavalry. Served as a member of the Council of Ten in the Provisional Government of Kentucky. Returned to the Confederate medical service from 1862 to 1865 in various capacities as a surgeon with the Fourth Kentucky Cavalry under Humphrey Marshall. Ultimately as medical director for the Department of Southwest Virginia and East Tennessee. Joined with General John C. Breckinridge in North Carolina until he surrendered in June 1865. Returned to Kentucky and recommenced his work as a physician and surgeon.
